column4: Hi. I'm running a command that redirects its output to a file like this: command > file. but the file won't get updated in real time. how do I do that ,
can I have it :)
you mean the color theme? Sure why not.
np :-)
don't download that one please...
I can't see it at all
that's good, because it contained some personal data :-/
no passwords or so, don't get excited ;-)
ah, I see, it's only readable by root, I'll fix that, just a sec
the .viminfo was not useful anyway, only contained last opened files and such, no config. My .vim file is empty, it gets the settings from a global /etc-setting...
So where's the vim theme then ? :p
the .bashrc file takes care of most of the coloring, but I'll look up where my Vim get it's color set from.
found it...I'll upload it shortly.
THaank you: )
u use any plugins?
no I don't.
here you are: www.tschai.nl/vimrc
put it in /etc/vim for machine-wide settings.
danke
I'm not German, in Dutch it would be: "bedankt"
but anyway, you are wellcome :-)
